meanings.definition: To put or sink below the surface of water or any other enveloping medium.
meanings.sent1: I will submerge the toy boat in the bathtub.
meanings.sent2: The submarine can submerge to great depths in the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous duck loves to submerge its head in the pond.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts would submerge her into a sea of contemplation.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the night seemed to submerge everything in its embrace.

meanings.definition: To cover or overflow with water; inundate.
meanings.sent1: Heavy rain can quickly submerge a small garden.
meanings.sent2: The flash flood threatened to submerge the entire town.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing sink seemed determined to submerge the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent4: Emotions of joy would submerge her heart like a tidal wave.
meanings.sent5: The river's rising waters began to submerge the nearby fields.

meanings.definition: To plunge or cause to sink below the surface of water.
meanings.sent1: The diver will submerge into the deep blue sea.
meanings.sent2: The weight of the anchor will submerge the buoy underwater.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick made it seem like he could submerge objects with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure threatened to submerge his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The sun slowly submerges below the horizon, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.
